summary: TLS server name override setting in client connection is being overridden by the address parameter due to a grpc-js library issue. The problem was resolved by updating the @grpc/grpc-js dependency to version 1.13.4 or higher.
userImpact: Users unable to connect to Temporal Cloud through Private Link or other scenarios requiring TLS server name override, affecting secure network configurations.
rootCause: The grpc-js library was not properly respecting the serverNameOverride parameter in channel credentials, causing it to be overridden by the address.
proposedFix: Update @grpc/grpc-js dependency to version 1.13.4 or later, or apply the fix in TS SDK 1.12.0 which addresses the issue upstream.
workaround: Pin @grpc/grpc-js to version 1.12.6 or manually update to 1.13.4 by running `npm update @grpc/grpc-js`.
resolutionDetails: Fixed by grpc-node PR #2956 merged in @grpc/grpc-js 1.13.4. Users can update dependency or wait for TS SDK 1.12.0.
keyQuote: We just confirmed that running Temporal TS SDK 1.11.8 with @grpc/grpc-js 1.13.4 works fine and allows connection to Temporal Cloud through Private Link.
